title: Mechanical Engineering (ME)
description: Comprehensive GATE Mechanical Engineering assessment covering General Aptitude and Core Mechanical Engineering subjects. This assessment includes 10 aptitude questions (15% weight) and 55 core mechanical engineering questions (85% weight) following the official GATE pattern.
whatIsDescription: GATE (Graduate Aptitude Test in Engineering) Mechanical Engineering is a national-level examination that primarily tests the comprehensive understanding of various undergraduate subjects in mechanical engineering and related fields. This assessment follows the official GATE pattern with General Aptitude and Core Mechanical Engineering questions.

typicalCareers.title: Mechanical Engineer
typicalCareers.description: Advanced mechanical engineering positions in design, manufacturing, and research

typicalCareers.title: PhD Candidate
typicalCareers.description: Pursue higher studies in mechanical engineering and related fields

typicalCareers.title: Research Engineer
typicalCareers.description: Senior technical roles in mechanical systems and thermal engineering

whoShouldConsider: Mechanical Engineering graduates preparing for GATE
Students seeking admission to M.Tech/M.E programs in mechanical engineering
Professionals looking for PSU jobs in mechanical sector
Researchers in mechanical engineering and related fields
idealTraits: Solid foundation in mechanical engineering fundamentals
Good understanding of mechanical principles and systems

modules: Core Mechanical Engineering Assessment (55 questions, 85 marks)

aptitude.title: General Aptitude Assessment
aptitude.description: Test your general aptitude including verbal ability, quantitative aptitude, and analytical reasoning skills. This section carries 15% weight in the total assessment.

questions.text: Choose the word most similar in meaning to "PROLIFERATE":
questions.subject: Verbal Ability - Synonyms
questions.explanation: PROLIFERATE means to increase rapidly in number or spread profusely. MULTIPLY is the closest synonym.

questions.text: If 5 machines can produce 5 widgets in 5 minutes, how many machines are needed to produce 100 widgets in 100 minutes?
questions.subject: Numerical Ability - Work Rate
questions.explanation: Each machine produces 1 widget in 5 minutes. To produce 100 widgets in 100 minutes (20 times longer), we still need only 5 machines.

questions.text: Complete the series: 2, 6, 12, 20, 30, ?
questions.subject: Numerical Ability - Series
questions.explanation: The differences are 4, 6, 8, 10, so the next difference is 12. 30 + 12 = 42.

questions.text: A train travels 180 km at a uniform speed. If the speed had been 9 km/hr more, it would have taken 1 hour less for the same journey. Find the original speed of the train.
questions.subject: Numerical Ability - Speed Problems
questions.explanation: Let speed = x. Then 180/x - 180/(x+9) = 1. Solving: x = 36 km/hr.

questions.text: Choose the grammatically correct sentence:

options.text: The committee have made their decision.
The committee has made its decision.
The committee has made their decision.
The committee have made its decision.

questions.subject: Verbal Ability - Grammar
questions.explanation: "Committee" is a collective noun treated as singular, requiring "has" and "its".

questions.text: In a class of 60 students, 40% are girls. If 10 more girls join the class, what percentage of the class will be girls?
questions.subject: Numerical Ability - Percentage
questions.explanation: Initially 24 girls (40% of 60). After adding 10, total girls = 34, total students = 70. Percentage = (34/70) × 100 = 48.57%.

questions.text: Find the odd one out:
questions.subject: Logical Reasoning - Classification
questions.explanation: Circle is the only shape without straight edges.

questions.text: If "GATE" is coded as "HCVG", how is "EXAM" coded?
questions.subject: Logical Reasoning - Coding
questions.explanation: Each letter is shifted by +2 positions. E→H, X→A (wraps), A→C, M→O.

questions.text: The average of 5 consecutive odd numbers is 27. What is the largest of these numbers?
questions.subject: Numerical Ability - Average
questions.explanation: If average is 27, the middle number is 27. The sequence is 23, 25, 27, 29, 31. Largest is 31.

questions.text: Which of the following statements can be inferred from: "All engineers are problem solvers. Some problem solvers are creative."
questions.subject: Logical Reasoning - Syllogism
questions.explanation: Since all engineers are problem solvers and some problem solvers are creative, it's possible (but not certain) that some engineers are creative.

core.title: Core Mechanical Engineering Assessment
core.description: Comprehensive assessment of core mechanical engineering subjects including Thermodynamics, Fluid Mechanics, Heat Transfer, Manufacturing, Material Science, Theory of Machines, Strength of Materials, and Vibrations. This section carries 85% weight in the total assessment.

questions.text: The first law of thermodynamics is a statement of:
questions.subject: Thermodynamics - Laws
questions.explanation: The first law of thermodynamics states that energy cannot be created or destroyed, only converted from one form to another.

questions.text: For an ideal gas undergoing an isothermal process, which of the following remains constant?
questions.subject: Thermodynamics - Processes
questions.explanation: Isothermal means constant temperature. For an ideal gas in an isothermal process, T remains constant while P and V change according to PV = constant.

questions.text: The efficiency of a Carnot engine operating between 400 K and 300 K is:
questions.subject: Thermodynamics - Heat Engines
questions.explanation: Carnot efficiency η = 1 - (T_cold/T_hot) = 1 - (300/400) = 0.25 = 25%.

questions.text: In a tensile test, the ratio of lateral strain to longitudinal strain is called:
questions.subject: Strength of Materials - Material Properties
questions.explanation: Poisson's ratio (ν) is defined as the ratio of lateral strain to longitudinal strain.

questions.text: A simply supported beam of length L carries a uniformly distributed load w per unit length. The maximum bending moment is:
questions.subject: Strength of Materials - Beams
questions.explanation: For a simply supported beam with UDL, max bending moment occurs at center and equals wL²/8.

questions.text: The stress that causes change in volume without change in shape is:
questions.subject: Strength of Materials - Stress Types
questions.explanation: Hydrostatic stress (equal normal stresses in all directions) causes volume change without shape change.

questions.text: Reynolds number is the ratio of:
questions.subject: Fluid Mechanics - Dimensionless Numbers
questions.explanation: Reynolds number Re = (ρVL)/μ represents the ratio of inertia forces to viscous forces.

questions.text: For a fluid flowing through a pipe, if the Reynolds number is less than 2000, the flow is:
questions.subject: Fluid Mechanics - Flow Types
questions.explanation: Flow is laminar when Re < 2000, transitional for 2000 < Re < 4000, and turbulent when Re > 4000.

questions.text: Bernoulli's equation is based on the principle of:
questions.subject: Fluid Mechanics - Bernoulli's Equation
questions.explanation: Bernoulli's equation (P + ½ρv² + ρgh = constant) represents conservation of energy for an ideal fluid.

questions.text: In a heat exchanger, the effectiveness is defined as the ratio of:

options.text: Actual heat transfer to maximum possible heat transfer
Maximum heat transfer to actual heat transfer

questions.subject: Heat Transfer - Heat Exchangers
questions.explanation: Effectiveness ε = (Actual heat transfer)/(Maximum possible heat transfer).

questions.text: Fourier's law of heat conduction states that heat flux is proportional to:
questions.subject: Heat Transfer - Conduction
questions.explanation: Fourier's law: q = -k(dT/dx), where heat flux is proportional to temperature gradient.

questions.text: The critical thickness of insulation for a cylinder depends on:

options.text: Both thermal conductivity and convection coefficient

questions.subject: Heat Transfer - Insulation
questions.explanation: Critical radius r_c = k/h, where k is thermal conductivity and h is convection coefficient.

questions.text: In orthogonal cutting, the shear angle increases with:
questions.subject: Manufacturing - Machining
questions.explanation: According to Merchant's theory, shear angle increases with increase in rake angle.

questions.text: Which welding process does not use a filler material?
questions.subject: Manufacturing - Welding
questions.explanation: Resistance welding (spot, seam) joins metals by heat from electrical resistance without filler material.

questions.text: In sand casting, the purpose of a riser is to:
questions.subject: Manufacturing - Casting
questions.explanation: A riser provides additional molten metal to compensate for shrinkage during solidification.

questions.text: The property of a material to absorb energy in the plastic range is called:
questions.subject: Material Science - Mechanical Properties
questions.explanation: Toughness is the ability to absorb energy in the plastic range before fracture.

questions.text: Austenite in steel is stable at:
questions.subject: Material Science - Phase Diagrams
questions.explanation: Austenite (FCC iron) is stable above 912°C in the iron-carbon phase diagram.

questions.text: The primary function of alloying elements in steel is to:
questions.subject: Material Science - Alloying
questions.explanation: Alloying elements like Ni, Cr, Mo improve strength, toughness, corrosion resistance, and hardenability.

questions.text: In a four-bar mechanism, the condition for a crank-rocker mechanism is:
questions.subject: Theory of Machines - Mechanisms
questions.explanation: Grashof's law: s + l < p + q (where s is shortest, l is longest) and shortest is the frame for crank-rocker.

questions.text: The instantaneous center of rotation for a link in planar motion is:

options.text: Always at the center of mass
The point where velocity is zero

questions.subject: Theory of Machines - Kinematics
questions.explanation: The instantaneous center is the point about which the link appears to rotate at that instant, where velocity is zero.

questions.text: In a slider-crank mechanism, the ratio of maximum to minimum speed is called:
questions.subject: Theory of Machines - Mechanisms
questions.explanation: Speed ratio is defined as the ratio of maximum to minimum speed in a mechanism.

questions.text: In vibration analysis, critical damping occurs when the damping ratio is:
questions.subject: Vibrations - Damping
questions.explanation: Critical damping occurs when damping ratio ζ = 1, separating oscillatory from non-oscillatory motion.

questions.text: The natural frequency of a spring-mass system is proportional to:
questions.subject: Vibrations - Natural Frequency
questions.explanation: Natural frequency ω_n = √(k/m), where k is stiffness and m is mass.

questions.text: A Rankine cycle operates between 30 bar and 0.05 bar. The efficiency increases if:
questions.subject: Thermodynamics - Power Cycles
questions.explanation: Rankine cycle efficiency increases with higher boiler pressure (increasing T_high) or lower condenser pressure (decreasing T_low).

questions.text: The purpose of superheating steam in a Rankine cycle is to:

options.text: Reduce moisture content at turbine exit

questions.subject: Thermodynamics - Power Cycles
questions.explanation: Superheating reduces moisture at turbine exit, preventing blade erosion and improving cycle efficiency.

questions.text: In a refrigeration cycle, the coefficient of performance (COP) is:
questions.subject: Thermodynamics - Refrigeration
questions.explanation: COP = Q_L/W can be greater than 1 for refrigerators and heat pumps, unlike thermal efficiency which is always < 1.

questions.text: The hardness test that uses a diamond indenter is:
questions.subject: Material Science - Testing
questions.explanation: Both Rockwell (diamond cone) and Vickers (diamond pyramid) use diamond indenters.

questions.text: Tempering of hardened steel is done to:
questions.subject: Material Science - Heat Treatment
questions.explanation: Tempering involves reheating quenched steel to reduce brittleness while sacrificing some hardness.

questions.text: Case hardening is a process used to:
questions.subject: Material Science - Heat Treatment
questions.explanation: Case hardening (carburizing, nitriding) hardens only the surface layer while keeping the core tough.

questions.text: The maximum shear stress in a solid circular shaft subjected to torsion occurs at:
questions.subject: Strength of Materials - Torsion
questions.explanation: In torsion, shear stress varies linearly from zero at center to maximum at outer surface.

questions.text: The polar moment of inertia of a solid circular shaft of diameter d is:
questions.subject: Strength of Materials - Moment of Inertia
questions.explanation: Polar moment of inertia J = πd⁴/32 for solid circular shaft.

questions.text: Euler's formula for buckling load is applicable when:
questions.subject: Strength of Materials - Buckling
questions.explanation: Euler's formula P_cr = π²EI/L² applies to long, slender columns where buckling occurs before material yield.

questions.text: In a gear train, if the number of intermediate gears is odd, the output gear rotates:
questions.subject: Theory of Machines - Gears
questions.explanation: Each gear reverses direction. Odd number of gears means output rotates opposite to input.

questions.text: The velocity ratio of a simple gear train is:

options.text: Product of driven teeth / Product of driver teeth
Product of driver teeth / Product of driven teeth

questions.subject: Theory of Machines - Gears
questions.explanation: Velocity ratio = (Product of teeth on driven gears)/(Product of teeth on driver gears).

questions.text: In a differential gear system, if both side gears rotate at same speed, the carrier:
questions.subject: Theory of Machines - Differential
questions.explanation: When both outputs rotate at same speed, differential pinions do not rotate relative to carrier, so carrier rotates at that speed.

questions.text: The dimension of kinematic viscosity is:
questions.subject: Fluid Mechanics - Dimensions
questions.explanation: Kinematic viscosity ν = μ/ρ has dimension [L²T⁻¹] or L²/T.

questions.text: The pressure coefficient in dimensional analysis is:
questions.subject: Fluid Mechanics - Dimensionless Numbers
questions.explanation: Pressure coefficient C_p = (p - p_∞)/(½ρV²) or equivalently p/(½ρV²) for gauge pressure.

questions.text: The head loss in a pipe due to friction is proportional to:
questions.subject: Fluid Mechanics - Pipe Flow
questions.explanation: Darcy-Weisbach equation: h_f = f(L/D)(V²/2g), showing head loss is proportional to V².

questions.text: The tool life equation (Taylor's equation) is:
questions.subject: Manufacturing - Tool Life
questions.explanation: Taylor's tool life equation: VTⁿ = C, where V is cutting speed, T is tool life, n is exponent (0.1-0.5), C is constant.

questions.text: In ECM (Electrochemical Machining), material removal takes place by:
questions.subject: Manufacturing - Non-traditional Machining
questions.explanation: ECM removes material through controlled electrochemical anodic dissolution using DC current.

questions.text: The primary advantage of powder metallurgy is:
questions.subject: Manufacturing - Powder Metallurgy
questions.explanation: Powder metallurgy produces parts very close to final dimensions, minimizing machining.

questions.text: The Stefan-Boltzmann law for radiation heat transfer states that heat flux is proportional to:
questions.subject: Heat Transfer - Radiation
questions.explanation: Stefan-Boltzmann law: q = εσT⁴, where heat flux is proportional to fourth power of absolute temperature.

questions.text: The Grashof number is used in:
questions.subject: Heat Transfer - Natural Convection
questions.explanation: Grashof number Gr = gβΔTL³/ν² characterizes natural (free) convection driven by buoyancy.

questions.text: The view factor (shape factor) in radiation depends on:
questions.subject: Heat Transfer - Radiation
questions.explanation: View factor (or configuration factor) depends only on geometry and orientation of surfaces, not temperature or material.

questions.text: In a Brayton cycle, compression and expansion processes are ideally:
questions.subject: Thermodynamics - Gas Power Cycles
questions.explanation: Ideal Brayton cycle consists of isentropic (adiabatic reversible) compression and expansion.

questions.text: The efficiency of Otto cycle depends on:

options.text: Specific heat ratio and compression ratio

questions.subject: Thermodynamics - Gas Power Cycles
questions.explanation: Otto cycle efficiency η = 1 - 1/r^(γ-1), depends on compression ratio r and specific heat ratio γ.

questions.text: In a Diesel cycle, heat addition occurs at:
questions.subject: Thermodynamics - Gas Power Cycles
questions.explanation: Diesel cycle: compression (isentropic), heat addition (constant pressure), expansion (isentropic), heat rejection (constant volume).

questions.text: The thermal stress in a constrained rod subjected to temperature change ΔT is:
questions.subject: Strength of Materials - Thermal Stress
questions.explanation: Thermal stress σ = EαΔT, where E is Young's modulus, α is thermal expansion coefficient.

questions.text: A material that has high hardness and low ductility is:
questions.subject: Material Science - Mechanical Properties
questions.explanation: Brittle materials (like glass, ceramics) have high hardness but low ductility and fracture with little plastic deformation.

questions.text: The slip planes in FCC crystals are:
questions.subject: Material Science - Crystal Structure
questions.explanation: FCC metals have {111} slip planes (most closely packed) with <110> slip directions, giving 12 slip systems.

questions.text: Normalizing of steel is done to:
questions.subject: Material Science - Heat Treatment
questions.explanation: Normalizing (heating above A3 and air cooling) refines grain structure and removes effects of prior processing.

questions.text: In CNC machining, the G-code G01 represents:
questions.subject: Manufacturing - CNC
questions.explanation: G01 is linear interpolation (cutting in straight line), G00 is rapid, G02/G03 are circular.

questions.text: In forging, the flash is the excess material that:
questions.subject: Manufacturing - Forging
questions.explanation: Flash is excess material that flows out between die parting surfaces and is later trimmed.

questions.text: The specific speed of a pump is a dimensionless parameter that depends on:
questions.subject: Fluid Machinery - Pumps
questions.explanation: Specific speed N_s = NQ^0.5/H^0.75 combines rotational speed, discharge, and head to characterize pump type.

questions.text: Cavitation in pumps occurs when local pressure drops below:
questions.subject: Fluid Machinery - Cavitation
questions.explanation: Cavitation occurs when pressure drops below vapor pressure, causing liquid to vaporize and form bubbles.

questions.text: In a centrifugal pump, the impeller vanes are curved backward to:
questions.subject: Fluid Machinery - Pump Design
questions.explanation: Backward curved vanes give higher efficiency, though lower head compared to radial or forward curved vanes.

questions.text: The critical point on a p-v diagram represents:

options.text: Point where liquid and vapor phases are indistinguishable

questions.subject: Thermodynamics - Phase Diagrams
questions.explanation: At critical point, distinction between liquid and vapor disappears; properties become identical.

questions.text: The area under a p-v curve represents:
questions.subject: Thermodynamics - Work
questions.explanation: Work done W = ∫p dv, so area under p-v curve represents work done by/on the system.

questions.text: The section modulus of a beam is the ratio of:

options.text: Moment of inertia to distance from neutral axis
Area to distance from neutral axis

questions.subject: Strength of Materials - Beams
questions.explanation: Section modulus Z = I/y_max, where I is moment of inertia and y_max is distance to outermost fiber.

questions.text: A beam subjected to pure bending experiences maximum bending stress at:
questions.subject: Strength of Materials - Bending
questions.explanation: Bending stress σ = My/I is maximum at outermost fiber (maximum y), zero at neutral axis.

questions.text: In a simple harmonic motion, the acceleration is:
questions.subject: Vibrations - SHM
questions.explanation: SHM: acceleration a = -ω²x, proportional to displacement and directed toward equilibrium.

questions.text: The phenomenon of resonance occurs when:
questions.subject: Vibrations - Resonance
questions.explanation: Resonance occurs when forcing frequency equals natural frequency, causing large amplitude oscillations.

questions.text: The Biot number in heat transfer is the ratio of:
questions.subject: Heat Transfer - Dimensionless Numbers
questions.explanation: Bi = hL/k = (convection)/(conduction). If Bi << 1, lumped system analysis is valid.

questions.text: The Prandtl number is the ratio of:
questions.subject: Heat Transfer - Dimensionless Numbers
questions.explanation: Pr = ν/α = (momentum diffusivity)/(thermal diffusivity) = Cpμ/k.

questions.text: In investment casting, the pattern is made of:
questions.subject: Manufacturing - Casting
questions.explanation: Investment (lost-wax) casting uses wax pattern that melts away when mold is heated, leaving cavity for metal.

results.title: GATE Mechanical Engineering Assessment Results
results.description: Your comprehensive GATE Mechanical Engineering assessment results with detailed analysis and recommendations for improvement.
